txt.en: A Man Adrift, Part 5: Paying Your Dues
Talk to the traders in the Fleet-fast and collect their dues.
'Where is Belondor? I will not pay you, outlander!'
'Oh yes, I have it right here.'
Talk to Belondor in Dâr Laja
Collect dues from the Fleet-watch Tavern

'I have another task for you, should you be willing.'

You quietly ask Belondor if he has decided whether or not to accept the offer from the Order of the Eagle.

'I have not. There are many things to consider. The cost may outweigh the benefit. Speaking of costs, life goes on and there are still things that need doing in the Fleet-fast.

'Traders that are permitted to sell their goods and services within the Fleet-fast are required to pay regular dues to be allowed to do so. When I am not at sea, this is something I like to do personally. It is good to be seen and to meet them in person, but the additional workload brought on by the re-opening of Dâr Laja has been taxing.

'You would be helping me a great deal if you would collect these dues for me. If any of them give you trouble, I guarantee that a little bit of rough handling will convince them that paying you is as good as paying me.'
Collect dues from the fruit peddler
You have collected the fishmonger's dues
You have collected the Old Bastion Inn's dues
Collect dues from the cloth dealer
Collect dues from the fishmonger
Belondor has asked you to go to the Fleet-fast on his behalf and collect dues from the merchants there.
You have collected the dues from the traders in the Fleet-fast. You should return to Belondor in Dâr Laja.
You have collected the fruit peddler's dues
You have collected the cloth dealer's dues
'Is it time for dues again already? Here, this should cover it.'
'Do you mistake me for a fool? I don't give money away to strangers!'
TBD OBJ Descrip
Collect dues from the Old Bastion Innkeeper
'Please, stop!  I will give you what I owe.'
'Excellent, I knew I could count on you [placeholder].'
You have collected the Fleet-watch Tavern's dues
'Oh yes, of course! Here you are.'
